data.title: Can select children on instanced scenes even when child selection is turned off
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits,
also tested on cdc4664226cdc397d054b7390d0f75028d40412c

This has been annoying me a lot today when designing a level with very small elements. I unwillingly messed up scene instances, so I investigated further.

![selection_box_children_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/20158782/db3eacbe-a6dc-11e6-8901-ada004f727e3.png)

Repro:
1) Create a thing.tscn with a Node2D as parent and a child sprite that is a lot smaller than 32x32, say 8x8
2) Create another scene and instance one thing.tscn
3) Try to select it with a rectangle selection: start with a corner very far away, and end with a corner that is very close to the thing
4) Notice the thing seems to be visually selected, but... the node won't be selected in the tree dock. That's actually because the child got selected.
5) Notice Ctrl+D won't work and display an error "Can't operate on nodes from a foreign scene!"
6) Disable selection of child nodes using the scene view toolbar
7) Try 3) again, notice the same problems occur.

Here is a test project:
[SelectionAreaChildren.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/582194/SelectionAreaChildren.zip)

A few things are wrong here:
- Child nodes can be selected even when the option is turned off
- It can happen on a scene where child nodes are not in editable mode
- The selection area of the instances is way too big

data.title: Better Collada Exporter from Blender to support Blender's Cycles Render engine
data.body:
Currently using Ubuntu 16.04, with Godot 2.1 and the current Better Collada exporter for Blender - and Blender 2.78.

**Background**
The Blender **Cycles** Engine has long been the standard render engine for Blender. The Blender [Internal Engine has been discontinued (per Blender devs)](https://twitter.com/dingto/status/268655993020350464) as of 2010, and is only included for backward compatibility - for now.

### Main issue:
The Better Collada exporter for Blender does not export textures or even basic colors when using **Blender Cycles**.  _Blender Internal engine support and development has ended._


**Issue description** When exporting from Blender, using Cycles, all textures, colors, etc. are lost and must be manually copied to Godot, and manually set on each mesh. This becomes overwhelming to support for the Godot user when dozens (or more) textures and colors are needed in a game.


**Proposed solution:**  Cycles, a node and tree based system like Godot, needs be supported - at minimum, Cycles' textures should be supported/exported.

**Attached** is a very tiny and very simple blender file containing a cube with one texture that is packed in the the Blender file. Using the Better Collada exporter, and checking the "copy textures" flag in the exporter results in a Godot Scene import with no texture at all.


[Blender_Cycles_to Collada_test.blend.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/581367/Blender_Cycles_to.Collada_test.blend.zip)

data.title: Godot visual scripting
data.body:
I understood that visual editing is there for shaders, but I would also like to do no-coding visual programming in godot scripting language.
Will this be possible?

data.title: Improving "Go to definition" in GDScript
data.body:
I would bet this would has been asked already, but I cannot find an issue about this.

It would be a great time saver if we could go to the definition of something in GDScript with a right-click menu + a shortcut.

- On a file name: open the file
- On a class name: jump to the position in that file where the class is
- On a function, var or const: jump to the thing, or open the file and go where the thing is defined
- On an API element: open the docs
- If all else fails... open global find :)

All this, of course, using the existing information the editor has / can get when parsing the file.
I've surprised myself too many times trying to right-click on something to "go to definition", noticing it's not there, and trying to remember where the thing is and open files manually and scroll :p

I apologize if this has been asked already but I can't find an existing issue :s

Edit: I renamed the issue since this already exists and supports some of the features

data.title: Make Android export quicker (especially on Windows)
data.body:
Remove (comment out, as some lines already are) a lot of debug output during the export process which adds noticeable time to the duration of the export process.

I say "especially on Windows," because I think on other platforms the console is not as slow and on them it won't make a difference. Less clutter, anyway.

data.title: Export immediately if only one device present
data.body:
I assume most developers exporting to Android (or other platforms) use only one device at once.
Now Godot always shows menu with device(s) which is ineffective as developer needs to click twice to run even if there's only one device connected:
![export_old](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19764492/20113652/923c99a4-a5f1-11e6-8afc-5c4c2d48f124.png)
I think it's better to run export immediately on menu button press if there's only one device connected and show the menu if there are more choices:
![export_new](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19764492/20113707/d22124fe-a5f1-11e6-8f44-acb2a89eefc2.png)
Device name / description (if there is only one) is shown in the button's tooltip.
I've also removed last empty description line as it looked bad in tooltips.

I was not able to test it on other platform than Android.

data.title: Putting a node below other node with subnodes automatically makes it a child
data.body:
The new drag and drop function is awesome, but a thing that can get really annoying really fast is that if you drop Node1 below Node2, which has subnodes, it automatically makes Node1 a child of Node2. That means that when you have a bunch of nodes with subnodes and you want to order them, you either don't use drag and drop or do a complicated tetris game moving the nodes with subnodes first, then the normal nodes, and repeat until you get it just right. 
The normal would be that when you put Node1 above Node2 it would go above, when you put Node1 over Node2 it should make Node1 a child of Node2, and when putting Node1 under Node2, it should go under.

data.title: Modulate for UI nodes
data.body: Some of the nodes which should have modulate doesn't even offer you an option to the change color or if it does it's a lengthy process. Nodes like panel, button, labels, etc. Having to create a new StyleBoxFlat and edit it's color (and update it by moving or something, you should look into that too, it's strange) every time you create a panel is very time consuming and makes the tedious job of making an UI into an ocean of boredom.

data.title: Auto completion gets blocked by helper in strings
data.body: When writing NodePaths or other kind of strings, the helper shows up to demonstrate the use of the current function. And it's **very** annoying. I've lost count on how many times I couldn't use the auto completion feature because it switched to the helper. Just try to get_node by script, it's way harder than it should.

data.title: RawArrays do not work from within Dictionaries
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: OSX 10.11.6
Godot: 2.1.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Referencing RawArrays from within Dictionaries and trying to manipulate them doesn't seem to work (and no warning/error messages are produced in the editor).

**Steps to reproduce:**
```gdscript
var d = { ra = RawArray() }
d["ra"].append_array("testing".to_utf8())
printt("result:", d["ra"].get_string_from_utf8()) 
# "result:    <blank>"
# expected "result:    testing"
```

append(), size(), etc don't seem to work, either (size() = 0). However, if you grab the RawArray ref from the dictionary and store it in a variable, then operations will work again. (You could then re-store the RawArray back in the Dictionary.)

```gdscript
# ...
var ra = d["ra"]
ra.append_array("this should work".to_utf8())
d["ra"] = ra
printt("result:", d["ra"].get_string_from_utf8())
# "result:    this should work"
```

If RawArrays can't work from Dictionaries for some reason, I suppose there should at least be some sort of error message in the debugger console.

data.title: Better tools for check method parameters
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Build compiled from this commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/611a94e3a673a61b51746366366c698c66ef0195
because in 2.1 stable get_method_list crash

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
1. I need to check how many parameters are needed to call a method, taking in account the optional ones. has_method only check if the method exist, and with get_method_list I couldn't find a way for check if a parameter is optional. 
2. get_method_list is **SLOW** for check if a method exist with n parameters, maybe create a variation of has_method which seems faster, like has_method(method_name, parameter_number = -1) for example and return true if the method could be called with that parameter number?, Of course taking in account optional parameters and parameter_number = -1 is the same behavior as current version.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a node with a method using optional parameters
example: func hello(param_a, param_b, param_c = 1, param_d = 2)
try to find a way to check if you could call the method with a number of parameters, for example:
func check_method_with_parameters(method_name,parameter_number)
that method should return true with the variations:
check_method_with_parameters("hello",2)
check_method_with_parameters("hello",3)
check_method_with_parameters("hello",4)

data.title: Can't query if a node has a method/attribute from a tool script to a non-tool one
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Build compiled from this commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/611a94e3a673a61b51746366366c698c66ef0195
because in 2.1 stable get_method_list crash

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
On my game I have a Trigger system, where the level designers could set external node methods or attributes from editor, those are activated and run/set the methods or attributes when those triggers enter screen in-game.

The Triggers which are TOOLS should give visual feedback to the level designer when the nodepath is correct and the method or attribute exist in EDITOR.

But nodes in tool mode can't check another non-tool node ones, has_method, get_method_list and get_property_list don't return the user created attributes/methods, only the default ones so if the dev look for an user created method, has_method for example always return false from a TOOL node to a NON-TOOL one.

![986bhda 1](http://i.imgur.com/5YELjfR.png)
In the Screen the Level designer could tell a Trigger to execute x Method (play_parry_song) from y NodePath (stage) with z Parameters when the Trigger enter screen in-game, in the editor preview there are the visual feedback from the trigger, we expect some checks like if method exist or has n Attributes or if the number of parameters from the method to execute are the same, taking account the optional parameters and show visual warnings in editor.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a node with a tool script
Make a node with a non tool script
Try to check in EDITOR if the non tool script has a method or a parameter using has_method, get_method_list or get_property_list methods (recommended way to test this is use a setget to access a method from editor)
 
**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Here is a demo for showcase how has_method, get_method_list and get_property_list methods are broken when the level designer try to test from a TOOL script to a node with a non tool one

How to test: 
Set the node_to_analize_path attribute from main node to analize_me, if all is working, the cmd console should print "xxxx is working" for each test. On latest source analize_me script without tool should return "xxxxx is broken" which is the bug.
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/2wzsnqxc50otxn6/reflection%20bug.zip

data.title: Distortion of audio through SamplePlayer2D
data.body:
Godot Engine v.2.2.alpha.custom_build by [cdc4664](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/cdc4664226cdc397d054b7390d0f75028d40412c) commit on Linux Mint 18 Mate x86-64

If you add a node SamplePlayer2D, add the sample and play it through a script or autostart node parameter, the sound is heard distorted (sounds faster and higher than the original). To the sound of the game could be heard as same as in the editor, you must set the pitch parameter by **0.9**.

data.title: Transition Nodes in AnimationTree do not take current transition into account
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When using the AnimationTree Transition Node to transition to a new animation, the current transition taking place is discarded. For example, if you use a transition node to swap between Idle/Walk, quickly tapping on the move key will result in the transition snapping to its end before starting a new transition, rather than transitioning from the point it currently is at.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Transition from one animation then back again before the transition is complete.

You can see it taking place with my directional swimming animations in this video. Instead of smoothly transitioning between the four different possible animations it snaps to the end of the transition before starting a new transition.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BaaCedLTpQc

I've already gotten around this limitation for my walk animations using blend nodes and script to transition between them, but it would just be a lot easier if this worked nicely by default.

data.title: Method to play sound in SamplePlayer at a given voice
data.body:
Hello!

I would like to ask for a method to allow the SamplePlayer node to play sounds at a given voice, just like in SamplePlayer2D and SpatialSamplePlayer nodes.

`SamplePlayer2D.play(sample, voice)`
`SpatialSamplePlayer.play(sample, voice)`

In canse of SamplePlayer, it is:
`SamplePlayer.play(sample, unique)`

And could be:
`SamplePlayer.play(sample, voice, unique)`

I'm in need of this for my musical instruments project in Godot. I don't need the SamplePlayer2D positional capabilities (there's the reason I'm not using it in place, not telling its max polyphony), and the code is getting much larger than it could be if this simple parameter in SamplePlayer existed.

Thanks, and I hope you consider my request! :smile:

data.title: OS X (El Capitan) delayed UI responsiveness to mouse interactions
data.body:
In an empty project, newly installed Godot, trying to follow the "Hello World" tutorial.  The user interface's responsiveness to mouse interactions is very poor.  Sometimes I have to click on a menu item or button 3 or 4 times before the UI responds.

Responsiveness is subjective but no other software on this computer exhibits anything like this behavior. I need advice on how to crack this open. I could screen capture a video.

I will remove all startup items to see if that reveals a hidden conflict. I'll post the results.

I first referred to this in [https://godotengine.org/qa/9630/godot-editor-interface-performance-bottleneck-on-mac-os-x?show=9697#c9697](url)

Godot v2.1.stable.official
Mac Pro (early 2009)
OS X El Capitan
2 x 2.66 GHz Quad Core Intel Xeon
16 GB 1066 MHz DDR3 ECC
nVidia GeForce GT 120 512 MB.

data.title: TileSet does not keep friction property after conversion
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The TileSet does not keep friction property after conversion. 
Using a StaticBody2D and setting the friction to 0 does not work properly. 
It acts as if it had friction with a value of 1 when you place it with the TileMap node.
This causes other RigidBody2D's to stop, even when it is supposed to slide, regardless of the friction value of the body itself.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create tileset with a staticbody2d tile and a collision box. 
2. Set friction to 0 on the tile
3. Convert to a tileset
4. Create a player or another rigidbody2d and make it move on top of the tile - it stops

data.title: Add License Notice for Two Files (A_Star)
Expression evaluater for debugging gdscript
data.body:
I would like to propose adding an expression evaluator to the gdscript debugger. This would be a text field where the user could enter a gdscript expression, and that expression would be evaluated in a certain context (perhaps the current debugging context, perhaps the context of the selected node in the live scene tree). The result of that evaluation would be shown to the user.

A text field and label for this could be added somewhere in the debugger->debugger tab, and/or the debugger->remote inspector tab, and the expression would be evaluated for that context.
